I recently stayed at Ibis and had an absolutely wonderful experience. From the moment I arrived, the staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive, ensuring every need was met with a smile. The room was immaculate, beautifully decorated, and equipped with all modern amenities, including a very comfortable bed that ensured a great night’s sleep.

The hotel’s location is perfect, situated within walking distance to several key attractions and dining options. The on-site restaurant served delicious meals, and the breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of options to start the day off right.

I also appreciated the hotel’s attention to detail in terms of cleanliness and safety measures, which made me feel very secure during my stay. The fitness center and pool were clean and well-maintained, providing a great way to unwind.

Overall, Ibis exceeded my expectations in every way, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable, convenient, and luxurious stay. I look forward to returning on my next visit

Review Title: Very convenient location and amazing staff! Would definitely come back!
Negative Reviews: The only thing was the the room and bathroom weren't super spacious, but we don't need all that much especially since we spent most of the time outside of the hotel room. We had two people in a 2 twin sized bed room and they did mention that the beds were a bit small. We had no issue with the queen sized bed.
Positive Reviews: Ibis Airport Hotel was such a convenient and affordable option for my group's travel plans! We were visiting Vietnam for the first time and we took advantage of the close distance to the airport plus the free airport shuttle that the hotel provides. The staff were super friendly and helpful and they all knew English which made it super easy for us during our stay. The hotel provides a bunch of services like laundry and luggage storage; we definitely took advantage of the free airport shuttle which I recommend you request in advance as they can fill up! One morning when the shuttle was full, the hotel staff went above and beyond and even offered to cover a taxi trip to the airport. They're so understanding and amazing! There is a Family Mart, a 7-11, and a few food/coffee shops very close by. The rooms aren't super spacious, but realistically we just needed a place to stay as we went back and forth to other places in Vietnam. I would definitely stay here again!
Room Type: Standard Queen Room  - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

If you would like to get pick up service, it’s better to call hotel and ask them to make confirmation before taking car even it showed LOGO with Ibis. Because it maybe the fake LOGO and car. So sad for the airport pick up service.

Review Title: Great choice hotel for stays near the Airport!
Negative Reviews: Limited beers available at the roof top bar, the ones we ordered from the menu were out of stock so we had to pay for more expensive ones.  You can get Pho on the room service menu but not on the roof bar menu.  We had just arrived from the UK and were after Pho, so opted to hit the street sellers instead of having room service.
Positive Reviews: Flying in (late) and then out (early) of HCMC, we decided to book a hotel close to the airport to save time and hassle.  The Ibis is right next to the airport (you cam see it from the international airport exit) so we decided to book it and also take advantage of the complimentary pick up / drop off (organised simply via email in booking.com).  We arrived in HCMC and were picked up straight away and taken to the hotel where we had a spacious room with separate living area.  Check in was quick and the room was very clean.  Nice shower, comfy bed.  There is a nice roof top bar with a chilled vibe (beers are a little pricey but that’s to be expected from a roof top bar).  The pool is up on the roof too and actually is a good size if you wanted to swim a few lengths.  Great English spoken, no issues whatsoever and we would return!  Thanks.
Room Type: King Studio - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Positive Reviews: We booked a studio room and it came with a full kitchen and sitting room, plus a separate bedroom. Very luxurious if you are used to IBIS's budget accommodations as we are.  The roof top bar was a great place to relax in the evening with a range of bar food. We didn't get to use the roof top pool next to the bar.  Free shuttle service to and from the airport, but make sure you can phone the hotel as our promised pick up was nowhere to be found.  Once we called a luxurious van arrived within 10 minutes, so no complaints on that score.  Allow plenty of time to get through Vietnamese customs and security.  Two hours for check in and getting through to the gate was just enough. An extra half hour would have been better.  And remember you need a Vietnamese visa if you are leaving the airport to stay at the hotel.
Room Type: King Studio - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Also next door is a Airport Shopping Mall which does not have many shops in it yet, but on the top floor are a selection of eateries with communal seating for eating. The staff were friendly and efficient. The shuttle bus was great although we missed it on arrival hence the early morning Jaywalking.

Review Title: Great amenities, excellent service, and CLEAN!
Negative Reviews: The room was very small, ok for one person but two might be a squeeze unless that doesn’t bother you. I need space. The shower overflowed onto the bathroom floor, poor design / bad flow.
Positive Reviews: The location is well appointed with only a short 5 minute shuttle ride from the aiport. There was a mix up with the meeting/ pickup which created an issue for me but it was resolved by flagging down the passing shuttle and jumping on. The hotel staff are seriously great. They didn’t try to justify their error and ‘Minh’ made it up to me by give me free long checkout (saving of $60AUD) which I greatly appreciated. The breakfast buffet was great with lots of variety, both western and Asian with some plant based options. The chef even made me a packed tofu banh Mi to take on the plane which I appreciated. The pool is great for early morning laps - it’s long enough and there’s a great view to watch the planes take off and land. There’s some great laneways and cafes in the streets around the hotel and then there’s a food hall directly on the right of the hotel in the shopping mall. I would utilise that next time as opposed to the hotel buffet. The shower was hot, the air con cold and everything worked really well. Would I stay here again? 100%
Room Type: Standard Queen Room  - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

room are cleaned daily unless you put a sign up. my room had garden view which is ok but less natural light. 
gym has decent equipment for cardio and free weights and a smith machine. clean and tidy gym room. clean wc but steamroom and dry sauna are not working properly.

Review Title: Good airport hotel for short stay with a great rooftop
Negative Reviews: Room had all the basics but was nothing special. The room was quite small and bathroom was tiny. The shower wasn’t great and was a bit moldy but did offer basic toiletries. Some areas of the hotel weren’t air conditioned(corridors and elevators) and the air conditioning turned off once exiting the room which meant it got quite hot whilst out of the room. not an issue as I was only there for a short while.
Positive Reviews:
I used this hotel for a 7hour layover instead of waiting at the airport, I was able to rest and refresh but did not actually stay the night so can’t comment on breakfast or noise overnight. 
Hotel was only a 5 minute walk from the airport however I wouldn’t recommend walking with luggage as the roads aren’t designed for pedestrians between the airport and the hotel (especially with big bag or kids). 
Hotel has a free shuttle to the airport which I utilized to return for my second flight. Staff were all lovely and helpful!

The bistro in the lobby was closed but the rooftop bar was great- with a rooftop pool, views of the city and good food I enjoyed sitting on the roof and having a meal.
There is also a Starbucks in the lobby. Good for a layover or short stay.
Room Type: Standard Queen Room  - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Review Title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
Negative Reviews:
Though I got the confirmation through Booking.com that we would have an extra bed in the room, when we arrived the extra bed had not been put down. After the hotel agreed to add said extra bed, we were told we had to pay extra for the breakfast, as it wasn't included in the price, despite us not wanting the breakfast. Again, we had to show our booking confirmation where IBIS clearly indicated that the extra bed was booked without the breakfast and that we agreed on it. 

When we checked out, the 2 counters which were operating were receiving both check ins and check outs at the same time. As new guests had just arrived, this meant that people who were checking out had to wait despite being on a tight timeline to catch the shuttle to the airport. Some people were quite angry at the situation and voiced it out.
Having one counter dedicated to check-in and one counter dedicated to check-out would make things much easier. 

After we arrived, we decided to order some food by the pool As the restaurant menu is not available between 3.00pm and 4.00pm we were asked to order from the room service menu, which we did. We ordered around 3.15pm, one hour later the food was still not ready.  Our food and drinks arrived long after the restaurant kitchen was actually opened.
Positive Reviews:
Traveling as a family, it is always hard to find a place which can accommodate the 5 of us. The IBIS family room was perfect for our family. Even with an extra bed, we still had a lot of room to walk around the room, which we didn't expect.

The swimming pool side is nice and helps to relax after a flight.

Having a Starbucks right inside the hotel was quite nice too.
Room Type: Family Room - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Positive Reviews: It's excellent location for transiting the Airport
Room Type: Standard Queen Room  - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Review Title: Not the cheapst option, but overallI I would recommend staying here for 1-2 nights before/after flying..
Negative Reviews:
At breakfast; 10mins before it ended one of employees told us really politly that breakfast will end in 10minutes. We were like yea thanks for info. Then after 5 minutes 90% of things were already taken away. Luckly we took everything we needed, but be careful if you are arriving late to breakfast (after long flight its haaard to wake up before 10). 
Because our jet lag didnt rly go away after 2 nights, we wanted to reserve 1 more night. At reception they gave us higher prize than what it was on booking. Which is strange but ok.. After an hour or so we tried to reserve on booking and the room was already gone.. So we went to other hotel for more then half of the prize for 1 night.
Positive Reviews: Roof top swimming pool was excellent for our kids. Room was really spacious. Breakfast had lots of options. Great option if you arrive from long flight and want to get rid of jet lag. Around the hotel, walking distance you have little shopping mall and on street a lot of options for coffee, food,…
Room Type: Family Room - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Positive Reviews: If you are a plane nut then this is THE place to stay. From the rooftop pool and terrace you can watch take off and landings from Tan Son Nhat International.
Room Type: Standard Queen Room  - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Positive Reviews: proximity to airport, nice clean simple room, airport transfer included. nice hot shower, roof top pool. lots of choice to eat close by.

Negative Reviews: The pool area had no staff in attendance through out the day and I had to go down to the lobby to ask for towels to be sent up. Also there was no option to order meals/drinks at lunch time at the pool; as the staff did not start until 4pm. Again I went down to the restaurant in the lobby to ask about getting a meal & drinks sent up to the pool. I was told the only way we could do this was to order room service and take it up to the pool. So we had to return to our room, order our meal then return to the pool. In that time our towels had been removed so had to go get more towels. All this inconvenience could have been fix with either one staff member in attendance at the pool during the day or a telephone at the pool bar with instructions to call & order meals/drinks over the phone. Safety around the pool should also be consider, no staff means anything could happens up on the roof... even if there is CCTV!
Positive Reviews: The pool was a god send as we had moved from another hotel in the city as it did not have a pool. Also the close proximity to the airport and free shuttle service for our departure was excellent.

Review Title: Good facilities, but don't expect advice on how to organise your self isolation to comply with rules
Negative Reviews: i booked this hotel to do my self isolation to ensure I would comply with all government regulations. This hotel had received good feedback on the re-entry Vietnam Facebook group as a good quarantine hotel. However, when I checked in, I was told that as of 7 Feb.22 they were no longer a quarantine hotel and they would not give an authoritative answer to my questions in relation to a confirmation at the end of my stay that I had completed my self isolation. I had booked for 3 nights thinking that was sufficient, but I found out that the arrival day does not count and that I needed to stay an extra night. Nobody form the hotel advised my that I needed to stay an extra night, and when I asked how long I had to stay, nobody was willing to answer my question and only referred back to the fact that they were no longer a quarantine hotel.
Positive Reviews: Got confirmation I would be picked up by hotel shuttle bus, but in the end had to wait 15 minutes for a taxi which was paid for by the hotel. I was only informed moments before getting in the car that the hotelshuttle bus was not allowed to enter the airport arrivals area.

We were disappointed to say the least, as it was a huge inconvenience for us, and we would have cancelled our stay and found a hotel that could accommodate it had they told us in advance and not when we checked in. Positive Reviews: Second time at this exceptional hotel. We chose this hotel because of location nearby the airport and the free shuttle and had low expectations but wow, it is an amazing hotel with a gorgeous infinity pool on the roof with view of the runway. A great roof top bar with the best gin and tonics we have had in our whole three weeks in Vietnam. They put on a delicious BBQ with salads the night we were there. So you can eat looking at this amazing view. The staff are so friendly and helpful, from the guys who greet you at the airport, reception, the bistro and bar staff. The breakfast is included in the cost and it has a huge selection of food, Vietnamese, Asian and western AND the best watermelon juice ever! I especially would like to mention Kim in the breakfast bistro who was so helpful as she could see I was struggling to decide what to have with my Pho noodle soup and came and helped me decide on the accompaniments.

Positive Reviews:
Great hotel near the airport for people not staying in Saigon for long. The room was an apartment with a nice sized kitchen and living area and separate bedroom and bathroom. It had more than most people would need for a night or two. The beds were comfy, the shower and aircon were both great. This hotel was the greenest we went to in the three weeks we were in Vietnam regarding waste and single use plastic. 
There is a complimentary shuttle too and from the airport. 
It's a bit of a drive from where it's at as far as location goes, so if you were wanting to spend more than a night or two in Saigon this wouldn't be the best place to stay.

Review Title: Staff were rude, but the Hotel was fantastic
Negative Reviews: Unfortunately the staff were not very nice. We arrived after a long 10h flight it was dark and we were tired so we went straight to the room to shower and sleep. There were only 2 bottles of water in the room which we drank straight away. (No water in the bedroom or bathroom) I rang room service for more and the lady literally said No that's all I can have? I said we are happy to pay and still NO! Room service is "24/7" and the restaurant was open but NO. I could order half the menu or a cocktail but not water. I was transferred to reception and after too much conveniencing, they agreed to send some up. BUT no one ever came. It's probably not so much the water but how rude dismissive and unhelpful they were. Not exactly the service they raved about in the room booklet...

Review Title: Superior accommodation close to the Tan son Nhat airport Ho Chi Minh city.

Positive Reviews: Superior accommodation close to the Tan son Nhat (domestic and international) airport Ho Chi Minh city. We were upgraded to a small apartment and this hotel is everything you expect from an IBIS hotel. There is a free shuttle bus to and from the airport (you have to arrange pick up and drop off with the reception staff), and there are many restaurants and coffee shops a short walk from the hotel. Staying at this hotel is a great way to start or finish your Vietnam journey if you arrive or depart from HCM city.

We stay the night and catch the internal  flight the next day (we are travelling with a 6 year old child).  The rooftop bar and pool are a great way to unwind, grab a bit to eat and watch the planes come in and take off.
 Breakfast was included for us and it was well worth it, a great variety of western and Asian plus lots of fresh fruit.  Vietnamese coffee was perfect as usual.

We complained about this at the reception and they said they had just changed their system and missed our booking for pick up. Then why did they keep our room booking? Because the pick up was free of charge and room was not, so it was convenient for them to forget about our pick up booking!  Simple apologies would have been enough but they only said “sorry” when we complained at the reception and never replied to our emails or in booking.com chat. Negative Reviews:
Transfer from the airport to the hotel took a very long time. A person who was supposed to meet us upon our arrival wasn't there, didn't pick up the phone, and ignored  WhatsApp messages for 15 minutes. Then we had to wait for another passenger, and then for a driver to arrive. 
 We had an overnight stay in between flights, and time was really crucial for us, as we needed to sleep. So it would be faster to get a taxi from the airport, as the hotel was only 4 minutes away.
At the reception we found only 1 person working, which is strange, as this is an airport hotel and they were expecting guests from the transfer. So we had to wait some more.

And the last unpleasant surprise was a limited room service menu. All items are available until 10-30 pm. We'd arrived around midnight, so we had only 4 options available on the menu. That's a very limited choice, considering that it's an airport hotel and people obviously use it in between flights quite often.

Review Title: A pity that the last night in Vietnam was in this disappointing hotel
Negative Reviews:
Our room was the smallest and the most expensive we had had in 20 nights in Vietnam, With 2 single beds - the narrowest they could be and still little room to move. I caught my shin twice on the wooden corner of the bed .
The lifts were difficult to make work -to get from our room on the 8th floor to the terrace on Top floor we often had to go down to ground level to then go up to the top floor 
We paid the extra money to keep the room until we were to go on their shuttle bus at 5pm but reception forgot to update the system so we were locked out of the room and not able to use the lift. To sort out this oversight my wife had to go to reception in  her swimwear. No apology was given for the problem the staff had caused us
Our plan was to eat before we went to the airport but BOTH restaurants were closed-no food available. We were told one was to open at 4pm but that did not help us.
Positive Reviews: the roof top swimming pool and sun terrace were beautiful (pool towels provided).Evening meal in the roof top restaurant was very good with excellent service. All this made better by the specular view over Saigon and its airport at night. The shuttle transfer was in a really luxurious vehicle-a stylish end to our tour.

Negative Reviews:
My wife opinion:
1. Service. I was walking to the hotel from the airport with a huge suitcase half my weight. The suitcase had a broken wheel and it was a real challenge. Finally got to the hotel. The three front desk employees didn't lift a finger as I crawled towards them, even when I stopped in the middle of the lobby to catch my breath. I never received any help.
2. The flush in the sink in the room did not work: it was plugged with a stopper that could not be pulled out.
3. The fridge is empty, no minibar, nothing. In the far corner, a hanged mouse is swinging slowly and sadly. Quite strange, considering that the room was not cheap, to put it mildly.

My opinion:
My wife came to you from the airport with a broken suitcase - and no one helped her. There were three of you standing there at the reception - you are the worst representatives of the vietnamese people and you disgrace them with your behavior. We have never encountered such vile and disregardful attitude as in this hotel, not worth its money and its stars. 

I curse you.

Negative Reviews: I booked this hotel for its location and as I had stayed in other Ibis hotels, I believed that the experience would be good and safe for my mother.  As my mother's flight was changed I urgently booked this hotel for her to stay overnight. I was in contact with a person who arranged an airport shuttle and informed them that she doesn't speak English. We agreed on the time she would take the shuttle bus back to the airoport the next day and they reassured me that it was arranged for her. In the end, the hotel personnel used the situation to their advantage: my mother was overcharged for the room, denied access to the swimming pool area of the hotel and instead of the shuttle bus back to the airoport she was offered to use a taxi. She used an online translator to try to fix all of that, but it helped only with a shuttle bus after she had to insist.

Review Title: Beware of over charging and location
Negative Reviews:
1. I didn't like the slow communication with the hotel by email. 
2. The room was tiny and smelt damp.
3. The hotel advertises itself as the  airport hotel but guests need a visa to stay there (unlike the airport hotel in Singapore) so even though I had a booking I had to spend 9 hours at the airport, and then I still had to pay for my stay at the hotel.
4. When I did finally get into the hotel on my return trip, with a visa,I was charged for 2 nights even though I had the room for 10 hours. So in total I've been charged over AUD $300 for 10 hours.
Positive Reviews:
Shuttle bus was convenient and beautifully air conditioned, the inside was clean and the driver was excellent. The bed, pillows and sheets were all very clean,  comfortable and a nice quality.
The air conditioner was excellent. Bathroom was good and nice hot shower.

Negative Reviews:
They charge you a service charge and VAT for eating at the restaurant without telling you beforehand. The amount of food was very very small for the price paid. 
The close proximity to the airport is a blessing and a curse. People coming and leaving at all hours and people noise as well as closing and opening of doors is very loud especially at 1am, then 3am. 
Rooms are quite small and this has been the least value for money. it was very disappointing actually.

Standard Queen Room  - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Negative Reviews:
We paid more than any other hotel in our 4 week stay in Vietnam and this was a disappointment. We received a free room upgrade, and the room was more like a mini apartment. There was a kitchen area, but no crockery or cutlery so was pretty useless. No coffee either. Worse of all we were woken at 6.00am by a loud banging that reverberated around the whole room. We were on floor 15  directly below the gym and the noise was probably someone dropping weights on to the floor. This wasn't just a bang or thud, it really jangled the nerves as it sounded like someone was going to come through the ceiling. It carried on for the next two hours, so we gave up on trying to get any sleep. The main reason for choosing this hotel was to be well rested for the long flight home. We complained and the staff were on the face of it understanding, and offered us free late check out. This was appreciated, but  that said the hotel must know that this is an issue and by this time the damage was done as we had our sleep disturbed.  The gym needs to be in the basement not on the roof.
Apart from that there were no major issues, but the most important thing is a good nights sleep. The rooftop pool was nice, although sunbeds were limited. The location was ok only in terms of airport access, however that was the reason we chose it. The staff were all lovely.
Positive Reviews: Friendly staff. Efficient, free airport transfer. Comfortable bed.
Room Type: King Studio - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Negative Reviews: I was very disappointed by my stay. I choose IBIS because it was close to the airport and was supposed to have a 24-hours restaurant, and breakfast served from 4.30am. This would have been ideal as I was passing by Saigon between 1 late flight and 1 early morning flight. I arrived at 11.30pm (not so late) but restaurant was closed. Then I enquired if I could have breakfast at 5am before going back to the airport. The answer was no. So I ended up going to bed without dinner, and boarding on my next flight without breakfast… Very frustrating as I only choose IBIS hotel for these late and early food services, services that were actually non existent. Fake advertising should be banned on Booking.com
Room Type: King Studio - Complimentary Round-trip Airport Transfer upon request

Negative Reviews: At least check with the customers if they need any support ...before just deducting whole amount of money please try and consider situation and then charge considerable amount.

Negative Reviews: The aircon is set up wrongly, so my parents was sleeping at 29 C degree. They told the staff and the staff kept saying:”follow instructions” even though my dad is 75 years old and told them that the aircon is so hot. Until 2am in the morning, the room was 28 or 29C degree and the window can not open, my mum kept calling the reception and noone picked up the phone. She went to the ground floor and 3 staff were sitting there and talk to each other and ignored the phone. My mum is sick until now. I think I should not pay for the price $153 including breakfast and received a bad service like that. Not recommended to everyone!!!
